Package runtime

Enum Instruction

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Instruction>
runtime.Instruction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Instruction>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum Instruction extends Enum<Instruction>
An Instruction that is executed in the context of an SML_Executor. Instructions are identified by their operation code and also use an operand as the address of memory they will operate on.
Author:
Alex Mandelias

      public static Instruction valueOf​(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
      Returns:

      Throws:

    • execute

      protected abstract void execute​(SML_Executor executor)
      Executes the Instruction, altering the state of the SML_Executor.
      Parameters:

    • of

      public static Instruction of​(int operationCode, int operand) throws InvalidInstructionException
      Returns the Instruction identified by the operationCode, while also specifying its operand.
      Parameters:
      operationCode - the Instruction's operation code
      operand - the Instruction's new operand
      Returns:
      the Instruction with the operation code and the operand
      Throws:
      InvalidInstructionException - if the operationCode doesn't correspond to an Instruction

    • opcode

      public int opcode()
      Returns the operationCode of the Instruction multiplied by 0x100 so that it matches the format of opCode * 0x100 + operand.
      Returns:
      the operationCode
